00019 int SymmetryAllowed(Symmetry sym, int pi, int j, int k)
00020 {
00021   if (sym==0) return 1;
00022 
00023   if (hasSymmetry(sym, spherical) && (j!=0 || pi==1)) return 0;
00024   if (hasSymmetry(sym, parity0) && pi==1) return 0;
00025   if (hasSymmetry(sym, parity1) && pi==0) return 0;
00026   if (hasSymmetry(sym, axial0) && k!=0) return 0;
00027   if (hasSymmetry(sym, axial1) && k!=1) return 0;
00028   if (hasSymmetry(sym, axial2) && k!=2) return 0;
00029   if (hasSymmetry(sym, axial3) && k!=3) return 0;
00030   if (hasSymmetry(sym, axial4) && k!=4) return 0;
00031   if (hasSymmetry(sym, rotatez2) && k%4) return 0;
00032   if (hasSymmetry(sym, rotatez3) && k%6) return 0;
00033   // if (hasSymmetry(sym, rotatey1 && ) return 0;
00034   // if (hasSymmetry(sym, reflectxz) && k==0 && 
00035   //    (j%4 && pi==0 || !(j%4) && pi==1)) return 0;
00036   
00037   return 1;
00038 }

00041 void extractSymmetryfromString(char** str, Symmetry* S)
00042 {
00043   *S = 0;
00044   char *c, *s = *str;
00045 
00046   while (1) {
00047     c = strtok(s, ": >");
00048     if (c == NULL) {
00049       *str = c;
00050       return;
00051     }
00052 
00053     if (!strcmp(c, "parity0")) setSymmetry(S, parity0);
00054     else if (!strcmp(c, "parity1")) setSymmetry(S, parity1);
00055     else if (!strcmp(c, "spherical")) setSymmetry(S, spherical);
00056     else if (!strcmp(c, "axial0")) setSymmetry(S, axial0);
00057     else if (!strcmp(c, "axial1")) setSymmetry(S, axial1);
00058     else if (!strcmp(c, "axial2")) setSymmetry(S, axial2);
00059     else if (!strcmp(c, "axial3")) setSymmetry(S, axial3);
00060     else if (!strcmp(c, "axial4")) setSymmetry(S, axial4);
00061     else if (!strcmp(c, "rotatez2")) setSymmetry(S, rotatez2);
00062     else if (!strcmp(c, "rotatez3")) setSymmetry(S, rotatez3);
00063     else if (!strcmp(c, "rotatey1")) setSymmetry(S, rotatey1);
00064     else if (!strcmp(c, "reflectxz")) setSymmetry(S, reflectxz);
00065     else if (!strcmp(c, "reflectxy")) setSymmetry(S, reflectxy);
00066     else { 
00067       *str = c; 
00068       return;
00069     }
00070     s = NULL;
00071   }
00072 }

00075 // doesn't handle multiple symmetries yet
00076 char* SymmetrytoStr(Symmetry S)
00077 {
00078   char* str;
00079 
00080   str = malloc(40*sizeof(char));
00081 
00082   if (S==0) sprintf(str, "%s", "none");
00083   if (hasSymmetry(S, parity0))   sprintf(str, "%s", "parity0");
00084   if (hasSymmetry(S, parity1))   sprintf(str, "%s", "parity1");
00085   if (hasSymmetry(S, spherical)) sprintf(str, "%s", "spherical");
00086   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial))     sprintf(str, "%s", "axial");
00087   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial0))    sprintf(str, "%s", "axial0");
00088   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial1))    sprintf(str, "%s", "axial1");
00089   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial2))    sprintf(str, "%s", "axial2");
00090   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial3))    sprintf(str, "%s", "axial3");
00091   if (hasSymmetry(S, axial4))    sprintf(str, "%s", "axial4");
00092   if (hasSymmetry(S, rotatez2))  sprintf(str, "%s", "rotatez2");
00093   if (hasSymmetry(S, rotatez3))  sprintf(str, "%s", "rotatez3");
00094   if (hasSymmetry(S, reflectxz)) sprintf(str, "%s", "reflectxy");
00095   if (hasSymmetry(S, reflectxy)) sprintf(str, "%s", "reflectxz");
00096 
00097   return str;
00098 }
